ArbiLinkUniversal Cross-Chain Messaging

Build once on Arbitrum. Connect to everywhere.

Get Started ‚Üí

GitHub
‚ö°

Simple Integration

One SDK call to send messages to any chain. No complex bridge integrations, no chain-specific logic.

üí∞

95% Cost Reduction

Powered by Arbitrum Stylus (Rust/WASM). Messages cost ~$0.23 vs $4.50+ with traditional bridges.

üöÄ

~12 Second Delivery

Optimistic execution with real-time tracking. Watch messages traverse chains step by step.

üîí

Secure by Design

Stake-based relayer network with 5-minute fraud-proof challenge window. No trusted intermediaries.

üåê

Multi-Chain Support

Ethereum, Base, Polygon, Optimism and more. Expanding continuously ‚Äî one integration reaches all.

üì¶

TypeScript SDK

Fully typed, tree-shakeable SDK. Works with ethers v6, viem, wagmi v2 and any EVM wallet.

Quick Example ‚Äã

Send a cross-chain message in 3 lines:

typescript
import { ArbiLink } from '@arbilink/sdk';

const arbiLink = new ArbiLink(signer);

const messageId = await arbiLink.sendMessage({
  chainId: 11155111,                              // Ethereum Sepolia
  target:  '0x742d35Cc6634C0532925a3b8BC454e4438f44e',
  data:    encodedFunctionCall,
});

// Watch delivery in real time
arbiLink.watchMessage(messageId, (msg) => {
  console.log(msg.status); // 'pending' ‚Üí 'relayed' ‚Üí 'confirmed'
});

How It Works ‚Äã

ArbiLink uses an optimistic delivery model powered by Arbitrum Stylus:

Your dApp (Arbitrum) ‚Üí sendMessage() ‚Üí MessageHub.sol (Stylus/Rust)
‚Üì
Relayer Network detects MessageSent event
‚Üì
Relayer calls receiveMessage() on destination chain
‚Üì
ArbiLinkReceiver.sol executes your target contract
‚Üì
5-min challenge window ‚Üí delivery confirmed ‚Üí stake returned
  1. Send ‚Äî call arbiLink.sendMessage() on Arbitrum Sepolia
  2. Relay ‚Äî a staked relayer picks up the MessageSent event
  3. Execute ‚Äî relayer calls ArbiLinkReceiver.receiveMessage() on the destination
  4. Confirm ‚Äî after the challenge window, delivery is finalized on Arbitrum

Built on Arbitrum Stylus ‚Äã

The MessageHub contract is written in Rust and compiled to WASM via Arbitrum Stylus, giving:

  • 10√ó cheaper gas than equivalent Solidity
  • Memory-safe execution environment
  • Native Arbitrum integration with minimal overhead
